person.persName: Wheeler H. Peckham (New York, Wisconsin, and Minnesota, attorney)

body.p: New York, Wisconsin, and Minnesota, attorney. Albany, New York, native. Son of Rufus W. Peckham. Married to Annie A. Peckham. Attended the Albany Boys' Academy from 1841 to 1849. Attended a French boarding school in Utica, New York, in 1849. Attended Union College in 1851. Traveled in Europe in 1852 and 1853. Read law at his father's law firm, Peckham & Colt, in Albany. Studied law at the Albany School of Law in 1853. Admitted to the New York Bar in 1854. Partner in the law firm of Peckham & Bloodgood in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, in 1854. Attorney in St. Paul, Minnesota, in 1860. Relocated to Albany in 1864. Partner in a law firm with George M. Miller and John A. Stoutenburg in New York City, New York, in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Minnesota, Ramsey County, St. Paul, p. 79; Edward Patterson, Memorial of Wheeler Hazard Peckham, Association of the Bar of the City of New York, May 8, 1906.
